result.execSummary:
The defendant James Latroy Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Domestic Abuse Crime [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Restitution set at $0.00.

Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
- NO CONTACT with victim DTR.
- NO CONTACT with firearms.

- Mental Health Evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Batterers Intervention Program, or a course in Anger Management.

- AODA assessment; comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Latroy Jones

records.addlTxt: filed.
Received and Filed. Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief
Received and Filed. Pre-Trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant James Latroy Jones appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Fard appeared by video for James Latroy Jones.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea/Sentencing Hearing. 

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statement made by DTR.

As to Count 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 years, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 year, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 year. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 4 years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
- Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- No contact with victim DTR.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- No contact with firearms.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Received and Filed. JURY INSTRUCTIONS
Received and Filed. PLEA QUESTIONNAIRE/ WAIVER OF RIGHTS AND ADDENDUM
Received and Filed. INELIGIBLE VOTING NOTICE

Defendant James Latroy Jones not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Fard appeared by video for James Latroy Jones.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Jury trial is scheduled for 9-26-22 at 8:30 am.  Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing before the jury trial date.  Case is adjourned to 9-16-22 at 2:00 pm for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's Motion In Limine, filed.
filed.
State's Motion for Joinder, filed.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant James Latroy Jones not in court, in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared by video conference.
Victim appears and makes statement requesting to modify no contact order.  Defense is requesting to modify the no contact order.  State objects. Court denied request to modify no contact order.   Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 9-12-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 9-26-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court is unable to hear this case and will reschedule court date.  ADA Claire Zyber and attorney Ashley Fard emailed new court dates.  Defendant is in custody.  Case rescheduled for Status Conference on 7/22/2022 at 8:30 am by zoom.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 10
Defendant James Latroy Jones in court, appear by video with attorney Ashley Fard, appear by video.  Defendant James Latroy Jones in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Greenfield Police Officer A. Sustachek.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant James Latroy Jones not in court, in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video conference.
Case in court for defense motion to modify bail.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIED defense request to modify bail.  Case remains scheduled for preliminary hearing on 6-27-22 at 8:30 am in Preliminary Hearing Court.
Received and Filed. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10

Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Ashley Fard in trial this week. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video conference.
Attorney Fard is now the attorney of record. Case remains scheduled for preliminary hearing on 5-23-22 at 1:30 pm in Preliminary Hearing Court.

No Contact Order
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DTR (dob 1/19/1966)

Defendant James Latroy Jones in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant James Latroy Jones in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James Latroy Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10 dur to lower pending matter.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
